challengeName: Aerohive Responsive Demo App - Node.js Server
detailedRequirements:
Welcome to "Aerohive Responsive Demo App - Node.js Server" Code Challenge. In this challenge, we need your help to create the Node.js server for our new Aerohive demo application that will be able to demonstrate API calls of our products for a retail clothing store.

Background Overview
Aerohive believes in a connected experience. Aerohive delivers an open mobility platform that simplifies and transforms the Connected Experience, through information, insights, and applications. Aerohive's Connected Experience is built on three core solutions that unlock the potential of mobility, and make networks easier to design, deploy, and manage:

Cloud Networking
Unified management designed to simplify administration with enhanced visibility and control, smarter troubleshooting, and flexible deployments through public, private, and on-premises solutions.

Great Wi-Fi
A fully distributed control architecture increases speed, scale, and resiliency, providing a foundation for connectivity that is supported by access layer switches and branch routers.

Applications & Insights
Business and IT applications that increase engagement and fuel business intelligence, powered by APIs, big data, and a partner ecosystem.

Importantly as a result, Aerohive has uniquely been able to create a rich and growing set of open RESTful APIs and a development platform to provide a foundation for Apps that showcase key insights and analytics via data collected while moving across the network on users and device behaviors and enable the ability to enact on that behavior. This is where developers come in! We love developers and encourage the very best and innovative Apps to grow on our platform and in return get visibility to over 30,000 end customers worldwide!

For this challenge we will be exploring a responsive demo for a retail clothing customer. The demo will contain three different Applications that our retail clothing store owners use. Although there will be a lot more functionality for each of these three APPs that will need to be explored, we are only focussing in on three specific use cases for this design challenge. 

Primary Goal
We are looking for you to help us create a Node.js server for our application that is able to demonstrate calls to Aerohive API and web socket communication with a client.

Competition Task Overview
The main task of this competition is to develop a Node.js server that serves all the required information by the provided storyboard designs.

Requirements

Node.js server
The server should be implemented using Node.js.
It will use express server, over HTTPS.
The communication with the client will be performed using REST API calls and web sockets (socket.io).

The server will eventually be hosted on Heroku, so please keep this in mind.
Also, the server will eventually serve an Angular application, which will act as the client.

The server will need to save a few types of entities in a database (Mongo DB) and to keep some information in memory.
The entities will be loaded from JSON files when the application is configured. Some of them may be updateable through the client application.
Below is a list of entities. If it makes sense to keep some entities, or attributes only in memory, please comment in the forums.
User
-username
-passwordHash

Product:
- name
- image

Customer:
- firstname
- lastname
- email
- phone
- country
- isVIP
- atStore

Device
- name
- ownerFirstname
- ownerLastname
- macAddress
- deviceType

Clerk:
- name
- atRegister
- notified

CustomerLimit
- limit
- activated

Purchase
- purchaseNumber
- customer
- product
- date
 
Aerohive Authentication:
The server needs to follow the authorization steps required to get authorized with Aerohive and use the API.

Aerohive API calls:
The server will need to support three types of Aerohive API calls: VIP notifications, store surge and geofencing.
The server will register to Aerohive API using Presence Webhooks. Aerohive will send the presence and location data to our POST method. If this data is not enough for our purposes, you will need to invoke extra Aerohive methods to retrieve the missing data.
The Aerohive data will be sent to the client application, using web sockets events.
The server could filter the results sent to the client, sending only the relevant information.
The developers should choose whether extra information should be sent along in the event, or if the client application should pull the extra information later.
For instance, the VIP API will give the information about the VIPs, but the product information is extra.
The history information should also be exposed by the server via a GET method, as it is not realtime information that should go through the websockets.

Testing the server:
In order to show that the server is functional, you are required to provide tests using Mocha.
The tests should act as a client to the application, emulating the calls that might come from the actual browser client.
Should have tests for each type of Aerohive API message exchange, and also for all the REST API expose by the server to the client (adding a customer, changing settings, adding a device, retrieving extra information about entities, ...).
